media.alt: Modern Atlanta property with professional property management
Modern Atlanta property with professional property management

children.text: Amanda is the primary point of contact for our property owners, ensuring clear communication and exceptional service. She provides detailed monthly financial reports, market updates, and strategic guidance to help owners make informed decisions about their investments.

With a background in customer success and account management, Amanda excels at building long-term relationships and anticipating client needs. She has helped dozens of property owners expand their portfolios and achieve their investment goals.
Amanda holds a degree in Communications from Emory University and is known for her responsiveness, professionalism, and genuine care for client success.

Robert oversees all maintenance and repair operations for Allay's managed properties. His extensive network of licensed, insured contractors and his hands-on approach ensure that maintenance issues are resolved quickly and cost-effectively.

With a background in construction management and 10 years in property maintenance, Robert brings valuable technical expertise to the team. He personally inspects all properties regularly and coordinates preventative maintenance programs that extend property life and reduce emergency repairs.
Robert's commitment to quality and efficiency has helped Allay maintain some of the lowest maintenance costs in the industry while keeping properties in excellent condition.

Jennifer leads our leasing team and is responsible for marketing properties, screening tenants, and ensuring a smooth move-in process. Her expertise in tenant screening has resulted in a 98% on-time rent payment rate across our portfolio.

With 8 years of leasing experience in the Metro Atlanta market, Jennifer has developed a keen eye for matching quality tenants with the right properties. She utilizes data-driven marketing strategies and comprehensive screening processes to minimize vacancies and maximize property owner returns.
Jennifer holds a degree in Marketing from Kennesaw State University and is passionate about creating positive experiences for both property owners and residents.

Michael has been with Allay since 2017 and manages a diverse portfolio of single-family homes and condos throughout North Atlanta. His proactive approach to property management has earned him consistent 5-star reviews from both property owners and residents.

With a background in real estate sales and investment analysis, Michael brings a unique perspective to property management. He understands the financial goals of property owners and works diligently to maximize returns through strategic pricing, cost-effective maintenance, and excellent tenant retention.
Michael is fluent in both English and Spanish, allowing him to serve Atlanta's diverse community effectively. He holds a Real Estate license and is pursuing his CPM designation.

Lisa brings over 12 years of property management and operations experience to Allay. As Director of Operations, she oversees all day-to-day management activities, ensuring that every property receives the attention and care it deserves.

Lisa's expertise spans tenant relations, maintenance coordination, and financial reporting. She has developed streamlined systems and processes that have helped Allay consistently maintain occupancy rates above 95% while keeping operational costs low.

Before joining Allay, Lisa managed operations for a boutique property management firm in Buckhead. She holds a degree in Hospitality Management from the University of Georgia and is known for her exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

David founded Allay Property Management in 2015 with a vision to revolutionize property management in Metro Atlanta. With over 15 years of experience in real estate and property management, David has built a reputation for transparency, reliability, and exceptional results.

Before founding Allay, David worked as a property manager for one of Atlanta's largest residential management firms, where he managed a portfolio of over 300 properties. He saw firsthand the challenges property owners faced with traditional management companies and knew there had to be a better way.

David holds a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration from Georgia State University and is a licensed real estate broker in Georgia. He is passionate about helping property owners maximize their investment returns while minimizing stress and hassle.

testimonials.quote: Allay's proactive approach to property management sets them apart. They do not wait for problems to arise - they conduct regular inspections, coordinate preventative maintenance, and keep me informed every step of the way. This is the level of service every property owner deserves.

The difference in my bottom line since switching to Allay has been significant. Lower vacancy rates, better tenant quality, and reduced maintenance costs. They have truly optimized my rental business.

I inherited a rental property and had no idea where to start. Allay educated me on the market, handled all the details, and now I have a profitable rental with zero stress. They made what seemed complicated incredibly simple.

Downtown condo rentals can be challenging, but Allay navigates the market expertly. They price competitively, market effectively, and keep my units rented with quality tenants. Their local market knowledge is invaluable.

I have been a real estate investor for 20 years, and Allay is hands down the best property management company I have worked with. They maximize income, minimize expenses, and handle everything with exceptional professionalism.

From the initial consultation to ongoing management, Allay has been professional, transparent, and effective. My townhome rented in less than a week, and the tenant they found is wonderful. I could not be happier with my decision.

Allay found better tenants than I ever did on my own. Their screening process is thorough, and it shows - on-time rent payments, respectful of the property, and they renewed their leases without issue. This is how property management should be done.

I have been with Allay since the beginning, and watching them grow has been impressive. They have maintained the same high level of service while scaling. My properties are in great hands, and the results speak for themselves.

Managing a fourplex was overwhelming until Allay took over. They keep all units rented, handle multiple tenants professionally, and the property cash flows better than ever. Excellent investment management.

The monthly financial statements are so detailed and clear. I can see exactly where every dollar goes. Allay has helped me optimize expenses while maintaining property quality. They truly act as partners in my investment success.

After a nightmare experience with my previous property manager, Allay has been refreshingly professional. They do what they say they will do, communicate proactively, and genuinely care about my success as an investor.

I chose Allay for their technology platform and stayed for their exceptional service. The online portal, automated rent collection, and digital maintenance tracking make everything seamless. Plus, their team is always available when I need them.

The RE/MAX backing gives me confidence, and Allay delivers on the promise. Professional marketing, quality tenants, proactive maintenance, and excellent financial management. They have helped me grow my portfolio significantly.
As a first-time landlord, I needed guidance and support. Allay walked me through every step, from pricing to tenant selection to lease agreements. They made the process stress-free and profitable.

Allay is transparent about everything - costs, timelines, market conditions. No surprises, no hidden fees. They marketed my condos effectively, found great tenants quickly, and the properties have stayed rented ever since.

I was spending 10+ hours per month managing my rental myself. Allay took over and I got my life back. They handle tenant issues professionally, coordinate repairs efficiently, and my tenant retention has improved dramatically.

The difference between my previous property manager and Allay is night and day. Faster responses, better tenants, lower maintenance costs, and detailed reporting. I have since moved all four of my properties to them.

I live overseas and needed a management company that could handle everything independently. Allay has been perfect - professional photos, strategic pricing, thorough screening, and seamless lease renewals. I feel confident in their hands.

The online portal makes everything so easy. I can see inspections, maintenance requests, financial reports - everything in one place. Allay runs like a well-oiled machine, and it shows in the results.

I appreciate how proactive Allay is with maintenance. They catch small issues before they become expensive problems. Their tenant screening is thorough, and I have never had a bad tenant in four years.

Managing a duplex was twice the headache. Allay handles both units expertly, keeps them rented, and coordinates all maintenance efficiently. The monthly financial reports show me exactly where my money is going. Excellent service.

The 12-month rent guarantee gave me peace of mind from day one. Allay has delivered on every promise. Professional, reliable, and they truly care about maximizing my returns while maintaining my properties well.

Managing five properties myself was exhausting. Allay took over and within three months had all properties rented with quality tenants. Their maintenance network is excellent, and their accounting is flawless. This freed up my time to focus on growing my portfolio.

I was skeptical about the fees initially, but Allay has proven their value ten times over. My property rented immediately at a higher price than I expected, and the tenant they found has been perfect. No regrets!

I have worked with three different property management companies over the years, and Allay is by far the best. Their tenant screening process is thorough, maintenance costs are reasonable, and I have had zero rent payment issues.

The transparency and communication from Allay is unmatched. I get detailed monthly reports, they respond to my questions within hours, and my properties have stayed occupied with minimal turnover. Highly recommend!

As an out-of-state investor, I needed a management company I could trust completely. Allay has managed my Atlanta properties for over five years, and I have never had a single issue. They are responsive, professional, and deliver consistent results.

I was nervous about hiring a property manager, but Allay exceeded all expectations. They found an excellent tenant within days, coordinate all maintenance seamlessly, and I actually make more money than when I self-managed.

After years of managing my condos myself, Allay has been a game-changer. They filled my vacancies in under two weeks, handle maintenance efficiently, and the monthly reports are crystal clear. Worth every penny.

Switching to Allay was the best decision I made for my rental properties. They handle everything professionally, communicate clearly, and my properties stay rented with great tenants. I actually sleep well at night now!

neighborhoods.name: Avondale Estates

children.text: Avondale Estates is a unique Tudor-style village with a charming downtown, strong community, and tree-lined streets. The small city offers walkability and proximity to Decatur.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Avondale Estates property management in Tudor-style village. Walkable downtown with MARTA access.

neighborhoods.name: Reynoldstown

children.text: Reynoldstown is an affordable intown neighborhood on the BeltLine with growing development. The area features bungalow homes, local businesses, and convenient access to downtown.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Reynoldstown property management on the BeltLine. Affordable intown living near downtown.

neighborhoods.name: Kirkwood

children.text: Kirkwood is a diverse, walkable neighborhood with bungalow homes, local businesses, and strong community involvement. The area is on the BeltLine Eastside Trail with convenient urban access.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Kirkwood property management on the BeltLine. Diverse walkable neighborhood near downtown.

neighborhoods.name: Ormewood Park

children.text: Ormewood Park is a quiet, family-friendly neighborhood with bungalow homes, tree-lined streets, and convenient access to I-75/85. The area is experiencing growth while maintaining its residential character.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Ormewood Park property management in quiet family neighborhood. Bungalow homes near downtown.

neighborhoods.name: Edgewood

children.text: Edgewood is a rapidly developing neighborhood with trendy restaurants, breweries, and the Eastside BeltLine Trail. The area is popular with young professionals and artists.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Edgewood property management on the BeltLine. Trendy restaurants and urban living.

neighborhoods.name: West End

children.text: West End is a historic neighborhood with Victorian homes, convenient MARTA access, and growing development. The area is experiencing revitalization with new restaurants and businesses.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: West End property management in historic revitalizing neighborhood. MARTA access and Victorian homes.

neighborhoods.name: East Atlanta Village

children.text: East Atlanta Village is a funky, artistic neighborhood with a thriving restaurant and bar scene. The area is known for its live music venues, local businesses, and creative community.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: East Atlanta Village property management in artistic neighborhood. Live music and creative community.

neighborhoods.name: Candler Park

children.text: Candler Park is an eclectic, walkable neighborhood with a strong community feel, bungalow homes, and local businesses. The area attracts artists, young families, and urban professionals.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Candler Park property management in eclectic intown neighborhood. Walkable community with MARTA.

neighborhoods.name: Inman Park

children.text: Inman Park is Atlanta's first planned suburb, featuring beautifully restored Victorian homes, tree-lined streets, and the vibrant Krog Street Market. The neighborhood offers urban living with historic charm.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Inman Park property management in historic Victorian neighborhood. BeltLine access and Krog Street Market.

neighborhoods.name: Old Fourth Ward

children.text: Old Fourth Ward is a rapidly developing intown neighborhood along the BeltLine with trendy restaurants, Ponce City Market, and modern apartments. The area is popular with young professionals.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Old Fourth Ward property management on the BeltLine. Modern apartments and urban lifestyle.

neighborhoods.name: Grant Park

children.text: Grant Park is a historic intown neighborhood surrounding the park and zoo of the same name. The area features Victorian homes, walkable streets, and a strong sense of community.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Grant Park property management in historic intown neighborhood. Victorian homes near zoo.

neighborhoods.name: Mableton

children.text: Mableton is a diverse, unincorporated community with affordable housing and convenient access to both Atlanta and Marietta. The area offers a suburban lifestyle with urban proximity.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Mableton property management in affordable West Atlanta community. Convenient to downtown.

neighborhoods.name: Austell

children.text: Austell is a diverse, affordable community with convenient access to Six Flags and major highways. The area is experiencing growth with new development and improving amenities.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Austell property management near Six Flags. Affordable West Atlanta rentals.

neighborhoods.name: Powder Springs

children.text: Powder Springs is a growing community with affordable housing, good schools, and convenient access to I-20 and I-285. The area is popular with families and first-time homebuyers.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Powder Springs property management with affordable family housing. Growing West Atlanta community.

neighborhoods.name: Lilburn

children.text: Lilburn is a diverse community with a historic downtown, affordable housing, and good schools. The area offers convenient access to major highways and shopping.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Lilburn property management in diverse Gwinnett community. Affordable housing with highway access.

neighborhoods.name: Lithonia

children.text: Lithonia offers affordable housing options and convenient access to Stone Mountain Park. The area is developing with new businesses and improving amenities.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Lithonia property management near Stone Mountain. Affordable East Atlanta housing options.

neighborhoods.name: Snellville

children.text: Snellville is a family-oriented community with affordable housing, good schools, and convenient highway access. The area offers a suburban lifestyle with close proximity to Atlanta.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Snellville property management with affordable family housing. Convenient East Atlanta location.

neighborhoods.name: Norcross

children.text: Norcross is a diverse, walkable city with a historic downtown, international restaurants, and convenient access to major highways. The area is popular with young professionals.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Norcross property management in walkable downtown. Diverse community with international flavor.

neighborhoods.name: Woodstock

children.text: Woodstock features a vibrant downtown with boutique shopping, restaurants, and live music. The area combines small-town charm with modern amenities and excellent schools.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Woodstock property management in vibrant downtown area. Boutique shopping and family living.

neighborhoods.name: Canton

children.text: Canton is the Cherokee County seat with a charming historic downtown, excellent schools, and growing retail development. The area offers a small-town feel with convenient access to Atlanta.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Canton property management in Cherokee County. Historic downtown and family neighborhoods.

neighborhoods.name: Suwanee

children.text: Suwanee is a family-friendly city known for its award-winning town center, excellent parks, and top-rated schools. The area features a strong sense of community and high quality of life.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Suwanee property management in award-winning town center community. Top schools and parks.

neighborhoods.name: Duluth

children.text: Duluth features excellent Asian restaurants, diverse shopping, and a revitalized downtown. The area is known for its international community and convenient access to major highways.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Duluth property management in diverse international community. Excellent dining and shopping.

neighborhoods.name: Acworth

children.text: Acworth is a lakeside community on Lake Acworth and Lake Allatoona, offering waterfront living and small-town charm. The area features a historic downtown, good schools, and outdoor recreation.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Acworth property management on Lake Acworth. Lakeside living with small-town charm.

neighborhoods.name: Lawrenceville

children.text: Lawrenceville is the county seat of Gwinnett County, featuring a charming downtown square, diverse community, and affordable housing. The area offers good schools and convenient highway access.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Lawrenceville property management in Gwinnett County seat. Affordable family neighborhoods.

neighborhoods.name: Peachtree Corners

children.text: Peachtree Corners is a master-planned city with excellent technology infrastructure, modern amenities, and good schools. The area attracts professionals working in the technology corridor.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Peachtree Corners property management in technology corridor. Modern planned community.

neighborhoods.name: Stone Mountain

children.text: Stone Mountain is known for its iconic granite outcropping and surrounding park. The area offers affordable housing, diverse communities, and convenient access to Interstate 285.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Stone Mountain property management near historic park. Affordable East Atlanta rentals.

neighborhoods.name: Chamblee

children.text: Chamblee is a diverse, revitalized city with excellent MARTA access, international restaurants along Buford Highway, and affordable housing. The area appeals to young professionals and diverse families.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Chamblee property management with MARTA access. Diverse community along Buford Highway.

neighborhoods.name: Vinings

children.text: Vinings is an upscale community known for its luxury apartments, shopping at Vinings Jubilee, and scenic Chattahoochee River views. The area attracts young professionals seeking proximity to Buckhead and Atlanta.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Vinings property management in upscale riverside community. Luxury apartments near Buckhead.

neighborhoods.name: College Park

children.text: College Park is adjacent to Hartsfield-Jackson Airport, offering convenient access for aviation and airport employees. The area is undergoing redevelopment with new businesses and housing.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: College Park property management near airport. Convenient for aviation industry employees.

neighborhoods.name: East Point

children.text: East Point is an affordable community near the airport with convenient MARTA access and easy highway connections. The city is experiencing revitalization with new development and improving amenities.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: East Point property management near airport. Affordable rentals with MARTA access.

neighborhoods.name: Cumming

children.text: Cumming is the county seat of Forsyth County, offering excellent schools, lakefront living on Lake Lanier, and a growing downtown. The area attracts families seeking high-quality education and outdoor recreation.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Cumming property management near Lake Lanier. Family neighborhoods with excellent schools.

neighborhoods.name: Johns Creek

children.text: Johns Creek is one of the most affluent cities in Georgia, known for its top-rated schools, safe neighborhoods, and family-friendly atmosphere. The area features excellent parks and convenient access to major highways.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Johns Creek property management in top-rated school district. Family-focused rental services.

neighborhoods.name: Brookhaven

children.text: Brookhaven is an upscale city with a thriving downtown area, luxury apartments, and excellent schools. The area combines urban amenities with suburban feel, attracting young professionals and families.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Brookhaven property management in upscale urban neighborhood. MARTA access and luxury rentals.

neighborhoods.name: Kennesaw

children.text: Kennesaw is home to Kennesaw State University and offers a mix of student housing and family neighborhoods. The area features Civil War history, Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield, and growing retail development.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Kennesaw property management near KSU campus. Mix of student and family rental properties.

neighborhoods.name: Smyrna

children.text: Smyrna is a rapidly growing city with a revitalized downtown, excellent parks, and convenient access to Atlanta and Marietta. The city's Jonquil City moniker reflects its beautiful streetscapes and community pride.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Smyrna property management in revitalized downtown area. Growing community with convenient access.

neighborhoods.name: Marietta

children.text: Marietta combines historic charm with modern amenities, featuring a beautiful downtown square, excellent parks, and diverse housing options. Close to major employers like Lockheed Martin and Dobbins Air Force Base.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Marietta property management near major employers. Historic charm meets modern rental living.

neighborhoods.name: Tucker

children.text: Tucker is an affordable suburban community offering good schools, convenient highway access, and a growing downtown area. Its central location provides easy commutes to Atlanta, Decatur, and other major employment centers.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Tucker property management with affordable rentals. Convenient East Atlanta location with highway access.

neighborhoods.name: Dunwoody

children.text: Dunwoody is a thriving suburban city with excellent schools, abundant parks, and convenient MARTA access. Known for its walkable village area and family-friendly atmosphere, it's a top choice for professionals and families.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Dunwoody property management with MARTA access. Professional rental services in prime North Atlanta location.

neighborhoods.name: Alpharetta

children.text: Alpharetta is one of metro Atlanta's fastest-growing cities, known for its top-rated schools, family-friendly atmosphere, and booming technology sector. The area features excellent shopping, dining, and recreational facilities.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Alpharetta property management with focus on families. Top-rated school districts and professional rental services.

neighborhoods.name: Roswell

children.text: Roswell combines historic charm with modern amenities, featuring a picturesque downtown, excellent parks, and highly-rated schools. This family-oriented community offers a great quality of life with easy access to Atlanta.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Roswell property management combining historic charm and modern living. Family-friendly rental management services.

neighborhoods.name: Sandy Springs

children.text: Sandy Springs is a thriving suburban city just north of Atlanta, offering excellent schools, abundant parks, and convenient access to major highways. With a mix of apartments, townhomes, and single-family homes, it attracts young professionals and families alike.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Sandy Springs property management services with deep local expertise. Professional rental management in North Atlanta.

neighborhoods.name: Decatur

children.text: Decatur is a vibrant, walkable city with an award-winning downtown square, excellent restaurants, and top-rated schools. Known for its progressive values and strong sense of community, Decatur attracts young professionals and families seeking urban amenities with a neighborhood feel.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Decatur property management in walkable urban community. Award-winning schools and downtown square location.

neighborhoods.name: Midtown

children.text: Midtown Atlanta is the cultural heart of the city, featuring world-class arts venues, Piedmont Park, and a thriving urban scene. High-rise living with walkability to restaurants, entertainment, and major employers.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Midtown Atlanta property management for urban professionals. High-rise rentals with MARTA access.

neighborhoods.name: Virginia-Highland

children.text: Virginia-Highland is a charming intown neighborhood known for its bungalow-style homes, tree-lined streets, and vibrant commercial district along Virginia Avenue. Popular with young professionals and families seeking walkability.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Virginia-Highland property management in walkable intown neighborhood. Bungalows and historic charm.

neighborhoods.name: Buckhead

children.text: Buckhead is Atlanta's most prestigious neighborhood, known for its upscale shopping, fine dining, and luxury high-rise living. This affluent area offers a sophisticated urban lifestyle with easy access to downtown Atlanta and major employers.

neighborhoods.metaDescription: Luxury Buckhead property management with premium rental services. Expert management for high-end Atlanta properties.

faqs.question: How do I get my security deposit back?

children.text: Leave the property in the same condition as move-in (normal wear and tear excepted), clean thoroughly, complete all requested repairs, provide proper notice, and return all keys and access devices. We'll conduct a move-out inspection and return your deposit within 30 days per Georgia law, minus any deductions for damages or unpaid charges. You'll receive an itemized statement.

faqs.question: What if I need to break my lease early?

children.text: Review your lease for early termination clauses. Generally, you're responsible for rent until the lease ends or we find a replacement tenant (whichever comes first). We work with you to re-market the property quickly to minimize your financial obligation. Some circumstances (military deployment, job relocation) may have special provisions.

faqs.question: How do I renew my lease?

children.text: We'll contact you 90 days before your lease ends to discuss renewal options. We'll present the new rental rate (based on current market conditions) and new lease terms. If you wish to renew, simply sign the renewal lease electronically—it's that simple. If not renewing, you'll need to provide proper notice per your lease terms (typically 60 days).

faqs.question: Can I paint or make changes to the property?

children.text: Any alterations to the property require written approval from your property manager. This includes painting, installing fixtures, removing fixtures, wall anchors for TVs, etc. Small nail holes for hanging pictures are generally acceptable. Request approval before making any changes to avoid security deposit deductions.

faqs.question: What utilities am I responsible for?

children.text: This varies by property and will be clearly stated in your lease. Typically, tenants are responsible for electricity, gas, water/sewer, trash, internet, and cable. Some properties include certain utilities. Always check your lease for specific details about utility responsibilities.

faqs.question: Can I have roommates?

children.text: Yes, but all adults (18+) who will be living in the property must complete applications and pass our screening process. Each adult will be added to the lease as a tenant and will be jointly and severally liable for rent. Everyone on the lease has equal rights and responsibilities.

faqs.question: Do I need renters insurance?

children.text: Yes, all residents are required to maintain renters insurance with minimum $100,000 liability coverage. This protects your personal belongings and provides liability protection. Renters insurance is very affordable (typically $15-30/month) and can usually be added to your existing auto insurance policy for additional savings.

faqs.question: Are pets allowed?

children.text: Many of our properties are pet-friendly! Pet policies vary by property and owner preference. Check the individual property listing or ask during your showing. Pet-friendly properties typically require a pet deposit ($250-500) and monthly pet rent ($25-50 per pet). Breed and size restrictions may apply.

faqs.question: How do I submit a maintenance request?

children.text: Log into your resident portal and submit a maintenance request 24/7. Include photos if possible and describe the issue in detail. For true emergencies (water leaks, no heat/AC, electrical hazards, security issues), call our 24/7 emergency hotline immediately at the number provided in your welcome packet.

faqs.question: When is rent due and how do I pay?

children.text: Rent is due on the 1st of each month with a grace period until the 5th. You can pay online through your resident portal via ACH (free), debit card, or credit card. We also offer convenient auto-pay so you never miss a payment. Late fees apply after the 5th per your lease agreement.

faqs.question: What are your application requirements?

children.text: We require: minimum credit score of 620, verifiable income of at least 3x monthly rent, positive rental history from previous landlords, clean criminal background check, stable employment history, and no recent evictions. We want to help you qualify—contact us if you have questions about your specific situation.

faqs.question: How do I apply for a rental property?

children.text: Browse our available properties, schedule a showing, then complete our online application. You'll need to provide personal information, employment details, rental history, and authorize background and credit checks. The application fee is $50 per adult applicant. We typically respond within 24-48 hours.

faqs.question: Are management fees tax deductible?

children.text: Yes! Property management fees are 100% tax deductible as a business expense for your rental property. We provide detailed annual financial statements and 1099 forms to make tax filing simple. Consult your tax advisor for specific guidance on your situation.

faqs.question: What happens if my tenant breaks the lease early?

children.text: Our lease agreements include early termination clauses that protect you financially. Typically, the tenant is responsible for rent until we find a replacement tenant or until the lease end date (whichever comes first). We immediately begin remarketing the property to minimize vacancy. Any unpaid rent comes from their security deposit.

faqs.question: Can I see financial reports anytime?

children.text: Absolutely. Your owner portal provides 24/7 access to detailed financial statements, transaction history, maintenance records, inspection reports, lease documents, and more. You also receive monthly financial statements via email showing all income and expenses for the month.

faqs.question: Do you handle emergency maintenance calls?

children.text: Yes. We provide a 24/7 emergency hotline for residents to report urgent issues like water leaks, no heat/AC in extreme weather, electrical hazards, or security concerns. We can authorize emergency repairs up to your pre-approved threshold (typically $500) without contacting you first. For larger repairs, we'll contact you immediately for approval.

faqs.question: What if my tenant damages the property?

children.text: We conduct a detailed move-out inspection with photo documentation and compare it to the move-in condition. Repair costs for tenant-caused damage are deducted from their security deposit. If damages exceed the deposit, we pursue the tenant for the balance through our collections process. You're never responsible for tenant-caused damage.

faqs.question: How do you determine the right rental price?

children.text: We conduct a comprehensive market analysis comparing your property to recently leased comparable properties in your neighborhood. We analyze size, condition, location, amenities, school districts, and current market demand. Our goal is to find the optimal price that maximizes your income while minimizing vacancy time.

faqs.question: Do I have to make repairs before listing my property?

children.text: Not necessarily. During our property evaluation, we'll recommend repairs that will maximize your rental income and minimize vacancy time. Some repairs are required (safety issues, code violations), while others are optional improvements that can command higher rent. We provide cost-benefit analysis so you can make informed decisions.

faqs.question: How long does it take to lease my property?

children.text: Our average time to lease is 15-25 days from the day we start marketing. Most properties receive applications within the first week. If we don't lease your property within 30 days of active marketing, we reduce our management fee by 50% until it's leased—that's our 30-day lease guarantee.

faqs.question: What areas of Atlanta do you serve?

children.text: We manage properties throughout Metro Atlanta including Buckhead, Midtown, Decatur, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Alpharetta, Johns Creek, Marietta, Smyrna, Dunwoody, Brookhaven, and surrounding areas. We cover all of North Atlanta, East Atlanta, West Atlanta, and South Atlanta neighborhoods. If your property is in the Metro Atlanta area, we can help!

faqs.question: Do you charge extra for pet-friendly properties?

children.text: No. Managing pet-friendly properties costs the same as non-pet properties. However, we do recommend pet deposits and monthly pet rent, which you keep to offset potential pet-related damage. We help you set competitive pet policies that maximize your rental pool while protecting your investment.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum contract period?

children.text: No. While our management agreement is structured as annual, you can terminate with 30 days written notice at any time with no penalty. We don't believe in forcing owners to stay—we earn your continued business through excellent service.

faqs.question: What payment methods do you accept from owners?

children.text: We automatically deduct fees from collected rent before distributing proceeds to you, so you never need to pay us separately. If you need to pay for a specific service (like initial property preparation), we accept ACH transfer, check, or credit card.

faqs.question: Do multi-property discounts exist?

children.text: Yes. We offer volume discounts for owners with multiple properties: 3-5 properties receive 5% discount on management fees, 6-10 properties receive 10% discount, 10+ properties receive custom pricing. Contact us to discuss portfolio management pricing.

faqs.question: How do you handle emergency repairs?

children.text: We maintain a 24/7 emergency hotline and can authorize emergency repairs up to $500 without prior approval (you set your threshold). For urgent issues over your threshold, we contact you immediately for approval. Emergency coordination is included in your management fee—you only pay the contractor's actual cost.

faqs.question: What if the tenant damages my property?

children.text: We deduct repair costs from the tenant's security deposit and pursue the tenant for any amounts exceeding the deposit. There are no additional fees for handling security deposit deductions or pursuing tenant-caused damage claims.

faqs.question: Do you charge for coordinating contractors?

children.text: No. Coordinating maintenance and repairs is included in your monthly management fee. We obtain multiple bids for major work, schedule repairs, supervise contractor work, and ensure quality completion—all at no additional charge beyond the contractor's actual invoice.

faqs.question: Can I choose a percentage or flat fee?

children.text: Yes. For most properties, we offer a choice between a percentage of monthly rent (8-10% depending on property value) or a flat monthly fee. Flat fees work well for higher-value properties where a percentage would exceed the value of services provided. We'll recommend the option that makes most sense for your situation.

faqs.question: What is included in the monthly management fee?

children.text: Everything needed to manage your property: rent collection and enforcement, tenant communication, 24/7 maintenance coordination, property inspections, financial reporting, online owner and tenant portals, lease enforcement, legal compliance, vendor management, emergency response, and lease renewal negotiation.

faqs.question: Do you offer tenant placement only (no ongoing management)?

children.text: Yes. Our tenant placement service costs 75% of first month's rent (one-time fee) and includes everything needed to find and place a qualified tenant: professional marketing, screening, lease preparation, and move-in coordination. After placement, you handle ongoing management yourself.

faqs.question: How do I receive my rental income?

children.text: We distribute owner proceeds via ACH direct deposit by the 10th of each month (or the next business day). You receive rent collected minus any approved expenses (repairs, management fees, etc.). You can view detailed financial statements 24/7 through your online owner portal.

faqs.question: What if I need to evict a tenant?

children.text: We coordinate the eviction process for $350, which covers notice preparation, court filing coordination, documentation, and communication with your attorney. You are responsible for actual attorney fees and court costs, which typically range from $800-1,500 total. Evictions are rare with our rigorous screening process.

faqs.question: Do you charge for property inspections?

children.text: No. All property inspections are included in your monthly management fee: move-in inspection with photo documentation, quarterly drive-by inspections, detailed annual interior inspections, and move-out inspection. No additional charges.

faqs.question: Are there cancellation or termination fees?

children.text: No. Our management agreement requires only 30 days written notice to terminate, with no cancellation penalty or early termination fee. We believe in earning your business every month through excellent service, not trapping you in a contract.

faqs.question: What about lease renewals?

children.text: Lease renewals are $150 or 25% of one month's rent (whichever is less). This covers market analysis to determine appropriate renewal rent, negotiation with the existing tenant, lease document preparation, and renewal coordination. If the tenant renews at the same rate with no changes, there is no renewal fee.

faqs.question: How much is the leasing fee?

children.text: Our leasing fee is 50% of the first month's rent, charged one time when we successfully place a qualified tenant. This covers professional photography, listing creation and syndication, property showings, application processing, comprehensive tenant screening, lease preparation, and move-in coordination.

faqs.question: What if my property sits vacant?

children.text: You only pay management fees on collected rent. If your property is vacant, you pay nothing for that month. However, we offer a 30-day lease guarantee: if we don't lease your property within 30 days of active marketing, we reduce our management fee by 50% until it's leased.

faqs.question: Do you mark up maintenance and repairs?

children.text: No. You pay the contractor's actual invoice price with zero markup. We believe in complete transparency—we make our money from management fees, not hidden markups on repairs. All invoices are passed through to you at cost.

faqs.question: Are there any setup or onboarding fees?

children.text: No. We do not charge any setup fees, onboarding fees, or administrative fees to start managing your property. Your only costs are the monthly management fee and the one-time leasing fee when we place a tenant.

faqs.question: What are your property management fees?

children.text: Our full-service property management fee is 8-10% of monthly rent (or a flat monthly rate for lower-rent properties). This includes unlimited marketing, tenant screening, lease preparation, rent collection, maintenance coordination, inspections, financial reporting, and legal compliance. We also charge a one-time leasing fee of 50% of first month's rent when we place a new tenant.

faqs.question: Can I use my own contractors for repairs?

children.text: Absolutely! While we have preferred contractors who offer competitive pricing and quick response times, you're welcome to use your own vendors. We'll coordinate with them just as we would with our network.

faqs.question: Who handles maintenance requests?

children.text: We coordinate all maintenance through our network of licensed, insured contractors. Tenants submit requests through our portal, we assess urgency, get quotes, obtain your approval (for non-emergency repairs over $500), and oversee completion. Emergency repairs are handled 24/7.

faqs.question: How does the 12-month rent guarantee work?

children.text: We guarantee you'll receive rent payments for the first 12 months. If a tenant defaults, we cover the payment while handling the eviction process. This exclusive program protects your cash flow and gives you peace of mind from day one.

faqs.question: What is your tenant screening process?

children.text: We conduct comprehensive screening on every applicant: credit report review (minimum 620 score), criminal background check, eviction history search, employment verification, income verification (minimum 3x monthly rent), rental history from previous landlords, and identity verification. Only applicants who meet all our strict criteria are approved.

faqs.question: How quickly can you find a tenant for my property?

children.text: Our average time to lease is just 15 days. We use professional photography, strategic pricing, and multi-platform marketing to attract qualified tenants quickly. Most properties receive showing requests within 48 hours of listing.

faqs.question: What is included in your 8% management fee?

children.text: Our 8% fee covers everything: tenant placement, rent collection, maintenance coordination, monthly financial reports, lease enforcement, property inspections, 24/7 emergency support, and our 12-month rent guarantee. There are no hidden fees or additional charges.

children.text: Frequently Asked Questions
Quick answers to common questions from residents:
When is rent due?
Rent is due on the 1st of each month. We offer a grace period until the 5th, after which late fees apply per your lease agreement.
Do you accept pets?
Many of our properties are pet-friendly! Pet policies vary by property, so please ask about the specific home you're interested in. Pet deposits and monthly pet fees apply.
How do I submit a maintenance request?
Log into your resident portal to submit maintenance requests 24/7. For emergencies (water leaks, no heat/AC, security issues), call our emergency line immediately.
Do I need renters insurance?

Yes, all residents are required to maintain renters insurance with minimum liability coverage. This protects your personal belongings and provides liability coverage. It's typically very affordable ($15-30/month).

children.text: Property Management Across Metro Atlanta
Local expertise in 40+ neighborhoods and communities throughout Atlanta, Buckhead, Decatur, Sandy Springs, Roswell, and beyond.
Comprehensive Metro Atlanta Coverage

Allay Property Management serves property owners across Metro Atlanta with deep local expertise in every neighborhood. From Buckhead to Decatur, Sandy Springs to Stone Mountain, we know the unique characteristics, rental markets, and resident preferences in each area.
Why Local Expertise Matters
Accurate rental pricing based on neighborhood micro-markets
Understanding of local school districts and their impact on rental demand
Knowledge of commute patterns and resident preferences by area
Established relationships with local contractors and vendors
Familiarity with neighborhood HOAs, regulations, and community standards

layout.headline: Explore Our Neighborhood Pages

children.text: Atlanta Rental Market Insights & Owner Resources
Expert advice to help you make smarter investment decisions and maximize your rental property returns.
Atlanta Property Management with Heart
Local expertise, national resources, and a genuine commitment to your success. Meet the team protecting Atlanta property investments since day one.
How Allay Property Management Was Born

Growing up in Atlanta, we witnessed firsthand how rental property ownership can be both incredibly rewarding and frustratingly complex. Too many property owners were stuck managing properties themselves—fielding late-night maintenance calls, dealing with difficult residents, and constantly worrying about legal compliance. Others hired property managers who overpromised and underdelivered, with hidden fees and poor communication making ownership more stressful than it needed to be.

We founded Allay Property Management on a simple belief: property ownership should create financial freedom, not consume your time and energy. Our name reflects our mission—to allay the worries and stress of property ownership while maximizing your investment returns.

By combining deep Atlanta market expertise with the powerful resources of RE/MAX Metro Atlanta, we've built a property management company that delivers results other managers simply can't match. Complete transparency in pricing. Guaranteed leasing timelines. Proactive communication. And most importantly, genuine care for your investment success.

Today, we manage properties across Metro Atlanta for owners who value professionalism, honesty, and results. Every decision we make is guided by one question: 'Is this what's best for our property owners?' That commitment has earned us a client retention rate that sets the standard in our industry.

layout.heading: Meet the Allay Team
layout.subheading: Experienced professionals dedicated to maximizing your investment and minimizing your stress

Complete Investment Solution:
Seamless transition when you want to buy more properties or sell—one trusted partner for your entire real estate journey
This powerful combination of local expertise and national resources means better residents, faster leasing, higher returns, and complete peace of mind for our property owners.

children.text: Property Management is Tax Deductible

Property management fees are 100% tax deductible as a business expense. This reduces your taxable rental income and can result in significant tax savings. Our monthly statements clearly document all deductible expenses for easy tax preparation.
Other Deductible Expenses We Document:
Maintenance and repairs
Marketing and advertising costs
Legal and professional fees
Insurance premiums
Utilities (if owner-paid)
HOA fees
We provide detailed annual tax documentation including 1099 forms. Always consult your tax advisor for specific guidance on your situation.

layout.embedCode: <iframe src="https://rentengine.io/c/allay?desktopViewStartAs=grid&mobileViewStartAs=grid&sortBy=id&defaultSortDirection=asc" width="100%" height="600" id="listings-iframe" frameborder="0" allow="camera https://app.rentengine.io"></iframe><script type="text/javascript">let storedHeight=600,storedScroll=0;window.addEventListener('message',function(event){const iframe=document.getElementById('listings-iframe');if(event.data?.type==='IFRAME_HEIGHT_UPDATE'){iframe.style.height=event.data.height+'px';if(event.data.scrollToTop){iframe.scrollIntoView({behavior:'smooth',block:'start'});}}else if(event.data?.type==='STORE_CURRENT_STATE'){storedHeight=parseInt(iframe.style.height)||600;storedScroll=window.pageYOffset||0;}else if(event.data?.type==='RESTORE_STORED_STATE'){iframe.style.height=storedHeight+'px';setTimeout(()=>window.scrollTo({top:storedScroll,behavior:'smooth'}),100);}});</script>

items.title: Transparent Reporting
items.description: Detailed monthly financial statements and online portal access keep you informed about every aspect of your investment.

items.title: Property Care Excellence
items.description: Regular inspections, preventative maintenance, and quality repairs preserve your property value over the long term.

layout.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
layout.subheading: Get answers to common questions about our property management services.

faqs.question: What is included in your 8% management fee?

children.text: Our 8% fee covers everything: tenant placement, rent collection, maintenance coordination, monthly financial reports, lease enforcement, property inspections, 24/7 emergency support, and our 12-month rent guarantee. There are no hidden fees or additional charges.

faqs.question: How quickly can you find a tenant for my property?

children.text: Our average time to lease is just 15 days. We use professional photography, strategic pricing, and multi-platform marketing to attract qualified tenants quickly. Most properties receive showing requests within 48 hours of listing.

faqs.question: What is your tenant screening process?

children.text: We conduct comprehensive screening on every applicant: credit report review (minimum 620 score), criminal background check, eviction history search, employment verification, income verification (minimum 3x monthly rent), rental history from previous landlords, and identity verification. Only applicants who meet all our strict criteria are approved.

faqs.question: How does the 12-month rent guarantee work?

children.text: We guarantee you'll receive rent payments for the first 12 months. If a tenant defaults, we cover the payment while handling the eviction process. This exclusive program protects your cash flow and gives you peace of mind from day one.

faqs.question: Who handles maintenance requests?

children.text: We coordinate all maintenance through our network of licensed, insured contractors. Tenants submit requests through our portal, we assess urgency, get quotes, obtain your approval (for non-emergency repairs over $500), and oversee completion. Emergency repairs are handled 24/7.

faqs.question: Can I use my own contractors for repairs?

children.text: Absolutely! While we have preferred contractors who offer competitive pricing and quick response times, you're welcome to use your own vendors. We'll coordinate with them just as we would with our network.
